Subject: A0185-APP2749-S: FSAA scans erroring and BI erroring on Tier2 DB files
Description: A0185-APP2749-S: FSAA scans erroring on multiple reasons and BI erroring on Tier2 DB files: Stealthbits.StealthAUDIT.DataCollectors.FSAA.FSAAException: Tier 2 database does not match Tier 1 data; Access data needs to be reset in order to import this data. To reset scan data, set AccessGUID to 'RESET' in the SA_FSAA_Hosts table (all existing Access data in Tier 1 will be deleted!) at Stealthbits.StealthAUDIT.DataCollectors.FSAA.Util.RunInBackground[TResult](Action statusAction, Func`1 execAction) at Stealthbits.StealthAUDIT.DataCollectors.FSAA.Util.RunInBackground(Action statusAction, Action execAction) at Stealthbits.StealthAUDIT.DataCollectors.FSAA.BulkImportTask.InternalProcessRecord() at Stealthbits.StealthAUDIT.DataCollectors.Tasks.Task.StartExecute()
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c: Have a discrepancy between T1 and T2 data in your DB
What_We_Know__c:
Tier 2 database does not match Tier 1 data; Access data needs to be reset in order to import this data. To reset scan data, set AccessGUID to 'RESET' in the SA_FSAA_Hosts table (all existing Access data in Tier 1 will be deleted!)

The client needs to run "Reset Hosts" action in Maintenance for all affected tables.
Next_Steps__c: bulk import completes following the host reset
Solution_Comment__c: On this meeting we ran the Repair Hosts instead of Reset Hosts maintenance. This has fixed the discrepancy in the T2 Database. We checked the Bulk Import and Scan results, and they both seemed as they should.
